x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: City services are slow to fix local issues like potholes, broken streetlights, and illegal dumping. When citizens report a problem, it often gets lost between departments (e.g., the call center, public works, sanitation). There is no simple way to submit a request, no central tracking, and no feedback loop, leading to frustration, duplicate reports, and delayed fixes that impact safety and city finances.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A unified, mobile-first platform that funnels all citizen reports into a single, automated workflow, ensuring fast assignment and transparent resolution:

  • Customer Service Management (CSM): Every citizen submission (a pothole report, a broken pipe) is instantly logged as a Case, ensuring end-to-end tracking and ownership.
  • Service Portal & Now Mobile: Citizens submit a request in under 60 seconds using a simple form on a mobile app, attaching photos and GPS coordinates. They can track its status 24/7.
  • Flow Designer: Automatically routes the Case (e.g., "Pothole" goes to Roads Dept, "Water Leak" goes to Utility Dept) and assigns it to the correct technician, generating a Field Service Work Order.
  • Geolocation & CMDB: Uses GPS data to map the location of the issue and check it against existing city assets (like a streetlight CI), improving dispatch efficiency and helping city planners track problem areas.
